column2: Did I close my fist around something delicate? Did I shatter you?
Do you miss the rogue who coaxed you into paradise and left you there?
Forget Barbie, fuck Nicki, sh-she’s fake, she on a diet’, but her pockets eating cheesecake
Past the curses and cries Beyond the terror in the nightfall
Yeah my money so tall that my Barbies gotta climb it
Now my eyes leak acid rain on the pillow where you used to lay your head
I'd meet you where the spirit meets the bones in a faith-forgotten land
Your touch brought forth an incandescent glow Tarnished but so grand
And for your loving, I’ma die hard like Bruce Willis
The old widow goes to the stone every day But I don't, I just sit here and wait Grieving for the living
I came to win, to fight To conquer, to thrive I came to win, to survive To prosper, to rise To fly
I wish today it would rain all day Maybe that’d kinda make the pain go away.
I wish to know the fatal flaw that makes you long to be magnificently cursed
Now you hang from my lips like the Gardens of Babylon
Greatness is what we on the brink of
Staring out an open window, catching my death
Can't not think of all the cost and the things that will be lost
See, we become alive in the time of fear
In the cracks of light, I dreamed of you
How can a person know everything at eighteen But nothin' at twenty-two
I never worry, life is a journey I just wanna enjoy the ride
I got a princess face, a killer body, samurai mind
When we come out, it look like Princess Diana on the street
The skeletons in both our closets plotted hard to fuck this up
I just wanted memories, tried to make some with you Now I gotta erase some with you
A dwindling, mercurial high A drug that only worked the first few hundred times
Barefoot in the kitchen Sacred new beginnings That became my religion, listen
Familiarity breeds contempt So put mе in the basement Whеn I want the penthouse of your heart
I fly with the stars in the skies I am no longer trying to survive, I believe that life is a prize, But to live doesn't mean you're alive
I get what I desire, it’s my empire And yes, I call the shots, I am the umpire
Spiderboy, king of thieves Weave your little webs of opacity
And I will retire with the crown, yes No, I’m not lucky, I’m blessed, yes
Hotter than a middle eastern climate
You understand now why they lost their minds and fought the wars And why I've spent my whole life trying to put it in words.
No amount of freedom gets you clean I’ve still got you all over me
You could be the king, but watch the queen conquer
If I’m fake, I ain’t notice ’cause my money ain’t
While he was doing lines and crossing all of mine someone told his white collar crimes to the FBI
Cherish these nights, cherish these people Life is a movie, but there’ll never be a sequel
Lord, what will become of me Once I've lost my novelty?
Gold was the color of the leaves When I showed you around Centennial Park Hell was the journey but it brought me heaven
You own my heart, he just renting
Bad bitches, like me, is hard to come by
No one sees when you lose when you’re playing solitaire.
I’m not living right, I’m not living if you’re not by my side.
Bitches ain’t shit and they ain’t sayin’ nothing A hundred motherfuckers can’t tell me nothing
Sorry, I can't see facts through all of my fury
They’ll never thank me for opening doors But they ain’t even thank Jesus when he died on the cross
Call it a curse Or just call me blessed If you can’t handle my worst You ain’t getting my best
Truth is, we mess up ’til we get it right
You drew stars around my scars but now I’m bleeding
You said it was a great love, one for the ages But if the story’s over, why am I still writing pages?
People’ll love you and support you when it’s beneficial I’ma forgive, I won’t forget, but I’ma dead the issue
These hoes couldn’t test me Even if their name was Pop Quiz
And you’ll save all your dirtiest jokes for me And at every table, I’ll save you a seat, lover
Cause you got her on your arm and me in the wings I'll get your longing glances, but she'll get your ring
I’m throwing shade like it’s sunny.
And all of my heroes die all alone. Help me hold on to you.
Yo, like MJ doctor, they killing me Propofol, I know they hope I fall
It takes everything in me just to get up each day But it’s wonderful to see that you’re okay
I want to watch wisteria grow right over my bare feet ‘Cause I haven’t moved in years
We dope girls, we flawless. We the poster girls for all this
Your whole style and approach, I invented
That night we couldn't quite forget When we decided to move the furniture so we could dance
I knew you dancing in your Levis, drunk under a streetlight
We fresh to death, down to the shoes.
I’m still a believer but I don’t know why I’ve never been a natural All I do is try, try, try
Regret in your tears, know you taste ’em
They say big girls don’t cry Baby, I cried
With every guitar string scar on my hand I take this magnetic force of a man to be my lover
The mischief, the gift-wrapped suburban dreams Sorry for not winning you an arcade ring
Let’s be real, all you bitches wanna look like me
Face so pretty bitches wish they could slice me She just mad ’cause he never bought her ice like me
They say love's for show, but I would die for you in secret
But the monsters turned out to be just trees When the sun came up you were looking at me
They call me Ms. Bitch, but I don’t miss, bitch
And when we say it’s Hot Girl Summer, we ain’t talkin’ ’bout degrees
I know you don’t like me, you wanna fight me Always on my page, never double-tap like me
It was the end of a decade But the start of an age
I didn't have it in myself to go with grace 'Cause when I'd fight, you used to tell me I was brave
I write my own lyrics, a lot of these bitches gimmicks
Just between us, did the love affair maim you too?
When the Queen leave, bitches wanna come out like a cockroach
I'll get older, but your lovers stay my age
I’m the one that they tread like tractors And still can’t catch a break like fractures
All of the Barbies is bad It girls and we ain't playin' tag
I used to switch out these Kens, I'd just ghost
You held your pride like you should have held me
I’m a ten, so I pull in a Ken
Took this dagger in me and removed it Gain the weight of you then lose it Believe me, I could do it
All these bitches beggin' me to pass the baton, All these bitches tryna fit my crown and my wand
Clover blooms in the fields Spring breaks loose, the time is near
My castle crumbled overnight I brought a knife to a gunfight They took the crown but it's alright
I once believed love would be burning red But it's golden
Usually I'm a Christian but this peace is Buddhist
Bitches-bitches be talkin' shit, but they ain't got a pot to piss in
Long were the nights when my days once revolved around you Counting my footsteps Praying the floor won’t fall through, again
And all we are is skin and bone, trained to get along, forever going with the flow but you’re friction.
Should've kept every grocery store receipt 'Cause every scrap of you would be taken from me
I wish I’da hugged you tighter the last time that I saw you
